# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/panel.py
@source-hash: d8577557b7b5907c
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:00Z

## Purpose
Creates bordered panels for Rich console output with configurable styles, titles, and alignment. Part of the Rich text formatting library for Python terminals.

## Key Components

### Panel Class (L17-293)
Main renderable class that draws borders around content with optional titles and subtitles.

**Constructor (L38-69)**: Accepts a renderable content object plus styling options:
- `renderable`: Content to be wrapped in the panel
- `box`: Border style (defaults to ROUNDED)
- `title/subtitle`: Optional header/footer text with alignment controls
- `expand`: Whether panel stretches to console width (default True)
- `style/border_style`: Styling for content and borders
- `width/height`: Optional size constraints
- `padding`: Internal spacing around content
- `safe_box`: Windows legacy terminal compatibility
- `highlight`: Enable automatic markup highlighting

**Alternative Constructor - fit() (L71-105)**: Class method that creates a non-expanding panel (expand=False).

### Text Processing Properties
- `_title` property (L107-121): Processes title text - converts strings to Text objects, removes newlines, adds padding
- `_subtitle` property (L123-137): Same processing for subtitle text

### Core Rendering Methods
**__rich_console__ (L139-270)**: Main rendering method that:
- Calculates dimensions based on content and constraints
- Applies padding to renderable content
- Handles safe box character substitution for Windows compatibility
- Contains nested `align_text()` function (L157-199) for title/subtitle alignment
- Yields border segments with proper styling
- Renders content line by line between left/right border segments

**__rich_measure__ (L272-292)**: Calculates panel dimensions by measuring internal content plus border and padding overhead.

## Dependencies
- Rich core: Console, RenderableType, Box, Style, Text, Segment
- Utility modules: AlignMethod, Padding, Measurement, cell_len
- JupyterMixin for notebook compatibility

## Key Patterns
- Uses generator pattern for console rendering (yields Segment objects)
- Applies cascading styles (border_style + base style)
- Handles Windows terminal compatibility through safe_box parameter
- Implements Rich's renderable protocol (__rich_console__, __rich_measure__)
- Text processing normalizes newlines and applies consistent formatting

## Test Code (L295-312)
Demo script showing panel creation with double border, padding, and styling.
